summary: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to renew and enhance Opportunity Zones. It modifies the definition of low-income communities, allows for a new round of opportunity zone designations, and extends the period for initial zone designations. It also adjusts investment incentives, including creating a consolidated basis increase for investments held for at least 5 years and special rules for rural opportunity funds. Furthermore, the bill introduces new information reporting requirements for qualified opportunity funds and businesses, and mandates public reporting of data on these zones, including economic impact metrics. The bill introduces penalties for non-compliance and makes related clerical amendments.
